title: Import raw kilosort4 data — import.kilo4
text: Base function import raw kilosort4 accompanying stimulus data. function looks csv file stim_data_file looks following files folder_path/kilosort4: spike_positions.npy 2D array giving x y position spike spike_clusters.npy integer giving cluster number spike spike_times.npy sample number spike occurred cluster_group.tsv 2D array giving status cluster (0=noise, 1=MUA, 2=Good, 3=unsorted), hand-curated cluster_info.tsv 2D array giving automatic output kilosort4. file needed cluster_group.tsv data. includeVector.mat MATLAB file giving whether cluster stimulus-responsive (1) (0)

code: new_neuron(   id_num = 0,   recording_name = "not_provided",   type = "generic",   genotype = "not_provided",   sex = "not_provided",   hemi = "not_provided",   region = "not_provided",   age = "not_provided",   sim = FALSE,   unit_time = "ms",   unit_sample_rate = "Hz",   unit_data = "mV",   t_per_bin = 1,   sample_rate = 10000 )

title: Initialize neuron object — new_neuron
text: id_num Numeric identifier neuron (default: 0). recording_name Recording () neuron based (default: "not_provided"). type Modeled electrophysiology neuron, e.g. "generic", "blackbox" "LIF", "McCullochPitts", "excitatory", "inhibitory", etc. (default: "generic"). genotype Genotype animal, e.g. "WT", "KO", "MECP2", "transgenic", etc. (default: "not_provided"). sex Sex animal (default: "not_provided"). hemi Hemisphere neuron neuron located, e.g. "left", "right" (default: "not_provided"). region Brain region neuron located, e.g. "V1", "M1", "CA1", "PFC", etc. (default: "not_provided"). age Age animal, e.g. "P0", "P7", "P14", "adult", etc. (default: "not_provided"). sim Logical indicating neuron simulated (TRUE) recorded (FALSE) (default: FALSE). unit_time Unit time spike raster recording data, e.g. "ms", "s", etc. (default: "ms"). unit_sample_rate Unit sample rate spike raster recording data, e.g. "Hz", "kHz", etc. (default: "Hz"). unit_data Unit data spike raster recording data, e.g. "mV", "spike", etc. (default: "mV"). t_per_bin Time (units) per bin, e.g., 1 ms per bin (default: 1.0). sample_rate Sample rate (units), e.g., 1e4 Hz (default: 1e4).
